Greg Price said:

Originality in UI design is easily overrated :smile:

Agreed, our goal is design is to work towards the best possible UI design (that we can reach with reasonable effort for the problem at hand). There are plenty of things that are unique about Zulip because we believe they are good UI; we don't need to add things that are unique just to be unique. So in practice, we will rarely have a goal of being original in design, except for the corner that is our logo/branding.
I love boring UI design. I love old school UI design. Can we bring back dialog boxes? The hipsters hate them, but it actually makes a lot of sense when apps actually ask you what you want to do next.

Dialog boxes got a very bad reputation in the late 90s because 5% of them were really poorly worded or poorly implemented or obnoxious.

But then they threw the baby out with the bathwater.

My personal pet peeve with Zulip is that we don‚Äôt have a dialog box when you create a topic. Maybe we save the user from an extra mouse click or tap on the enter key. But we have a confusing experience where we literally sacrifice having a dialog with the user.

Some folks have been finding animated status emoji distracting, which we can address by making them animate on hover only. I filed #19520.
Opened #19521 with a specific technical plan for implementing that, since it seems we raced :smile:
This was fixed for custom emoji uploaded in the future in #19563, thanks @Riken Shah (Riken-Shah)! I opened #19732 for the migration required to make this work for existing custom emoji.

I also now wonder if we should make animated custom emoji only animate on hover in messages and emoji reactions as well, at least under a setting. Thoughts on that question? I think it's be relatively straightforward to add given what we've already done.
